column4: im trying to install the nvidia drivers, but when i install them (and have nv be nvidia in xorg.conf) i reboot and get no screens found.. any ideas? using add/remove to install drivers on Feisty.
in a fresh Feisty install i was able to use nvidia drivers by simply clicking a checkbox in the restricted modules program
no xorg.conf changes required
ive done that aswell with the same results, no screens found
pretty sure when u enable restricted it changes the xorg
actually i was surprised to see that it doesn't edit xorg.conf
does your xorg.conf say "nv" or "nvidia" under device?
when i was using the restricted modules setup, no
i prefer my own kernel very much to the ubuntu one, so not anymore :)
can i see your xorg.conf?
okay, just a mom..
http://pastebin.ca/474376
pm
check that link.. i put it in a pastebin: http://pastebin.ca/474376
yea i saw it
msging you in pm
i didn't get a pm..
weird... what card are you running? and monitor? your config is quite different from mine...
laptop "nVidia Corporation GeForce Go 7800"; the twinview is so i can hook it up to a projector
gonna try with some of your xorg... brb!
best of luck
